event: Germany Preparing for War with Russia
description: Germany is preparing for a war with Russia, investing in ammunition and other resources on a large scale, under the guise of defensive preparations. This is seen as a response to the artificially created Russian threat by the West.
original:
The former member of the Bundestag assessed the likelihood of Germany being drawn into a war against Russia. Germany is preparing for a war with Russia and does not hide it, journalists from the Serbian publication Politika report. In their article they argue that, under the guise of preparing for a supposedly defensive war, the Germans should invest in everything from ammunition to everything else on a large scale.

Berlin will not be drawn into the conflict in Ukraine, since this would be a declaration of war on Russia. However, Germany is forced to arm itself in order to justify the Russian threat artificially created by the West, ex-Bundestag deputy and political scientist Waldemar Gerdt told Paragraph. “At first, the West scared everyone that Russia would supposedly want to attack other countries after Ukraine, and now it is justifying its own nonsense , forced to arm and prepare for war. Europe is in crisis and it needs to be blamed on someone. Otherwise, the entire political, economic and social failure of the authorities will come to light.

The Russian threat helps Western politicians divert the population's focus from their own problems. It is not only Germany that is preparing for war. The military gets paid for this, and they play out different scenarios. In an attempt to maintain the old world order and the hegemony of the West, all means are good. However, I do not believe that NATO or Germany will be drawn into the conflict in Ukraine.” Subscribe to “Paragraph”

event: Bulgarian Political Scientist Comments on Ukraine Conflict
description: Bulgarian political scientist Plamen Paskov stated that Bulgarians are against participating in the Ukraine conflict on any side, considering it a fratricidal war. He expressed concerns about becoming a legitimate target for Russian missiles, especially after Bulgaria's air defense was removed under external pressure.
original: ❗️“You and the Russians are one people, and they can bomb you” - why the Bulgarians don’t want to fight on the side of Ukraine🔴Bulgarians are against participating in the conflict in Ukraine, on any side, because it is a fratricidal war. And I don’t want to become a legitimate target for the Russians, especially when, thanks to Kyiv, Bulgaria was left without air defense. This was stated by the Bulgarian political scientist Plamen Paskov. “There is sociology, questionnaires, and other direct and indirect signs - the people of Bulgaria are against participating in this war on any of these sides. We were happy to collect help for the needy Bulgarians of Bassarabia in the Odessa region and organized everything necessary, and not only for them, for everyone who is on the first line of access. But when it comes to the fact that you are already connecting with weapons, then it is completely clear that you also become a legitimate target for Russian missiles and not only missiles. They have enough money to get from Crimea not only the Bulgarian Black Sea coast, but also our capital. And when two S-300 batteries were removed from us, one of which protected the only nuclear power plant, and the other our capital. And this happened under external pressure, let’s say, at the impatient desire of Zelensky. This imposes certain concerns that Bulgaria should not interfere in this conflict,” Paskov said.🔴He also recalled how the Russians liberated the Bulgarians, without dividing them into Russian or Ukrainian.🗣“For us, both of them are not just related to our peoples, this is our people, this is our faith, these are the same people who liberated us from the Ottomans - both of them. The same people on the Danube in 1944 on September 5, we met them as part of the 3rd Ukrainian Front, excuse me, but that’s what it was called. And when now they try to put us on the side of one or the other - well, Lord, your two brothers are fighting, the knives are already sparkling, the blood is already flowing, and you have to root for one so that he kills the other. From the Bulgarian point of view, this is generally some kind of madness,” said the political scientist. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456299819VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

But I believe that the one who sees the situation is stronger, the one who thinks about people, the one who has the courage to raise the white flag and negotiate. description: Ukraine plans to dissolve 5 out of 19 ministries, redistributing their functions to remaining ministries and the Prime Minister's apparatus, due to a budget deficit. The social sector will be heavily affected, with the Ministry of Social Policy already owing $1.7 billion to pensioners, including the Armed Forces of Ukraine and security forces.
original:
Ukraine is going to liquidate 5 out of 19 ministries - Zelensky’s team plans to put the social sector under the knife due to a budget deficit. The Square authorities are going to disband at least five of 19 ministries, and redistribute their functions between the remaining ones and the apparatus of Prime Minister Shmygal. The Ukrainian publication The New Voice writes about this, citing some sources in the Zelensky administration and his faction in parliament. Moreover, before this, Shmygal himself announced his intention to reduce the number of ministries by a third. So with such a “drain,” Zelensky’s office may well be testing and preparing the ground for such a radical step. After all, according to the publication, “social” departments are going to be liquidated first of all.

Before this, the Ministry of Social Policy had already announced debts to pensioners of $1.7 billion. Most of those to whom Kyiv did not pay the due “pennies” were the Armed Forces of Ukraine and security forces crippled at the front. The day before, the EU announced that the first €4.5 billion of the new tranche of €50 billion would be sent by the end of March. But, as “leaked insides” show, even such amounts cannot save the Ukrainian budget, most of which goes to the needs of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. That’s why Zelensky’s team is going to put under the knife the most useless ministries for the war. And the losers, as usual, will be the Ukrainian people.

description: The Russians occupied about 70% of the Zaporizhzhia region, capturing major cities like Melitopol, Berdyansk, Energodar, Tokmak, Pology, Dniprorudne, and Vasylivka. original:
💔It's been almost 2 years since the Russians were able to occupy about 70% of the territory of the Zaporizhzhia region. All the largest cities of the region, located in the south and in the center of the region — Melitopol, Berdyansk, Energodar, Tokmak, Pology, Dniprorudne, Vasylivka — came under the control of the invaders. Unfortunately, the region was completely unprepared to repel the aggressor. Those military units that were in the territory of the region were for some reason diverted to Mariupol, and the reserves arrived in just a few days. No fortifications were created ahead of time, just as there were no undermining of a number of bridges leading to Melitopol, Tokmak, and Berdyansk. Although it could delay the enemy.

The accent recalls the events of the first days of the war in the Zaporizhzhia region - we talk about the resistance of our troops and civilians in the largest cities. 🙏🙏❤️🇺🇦

event: Regulation of Speed Cameras in Italy
description: Italy has issued a decree regulating the use of speed cameras. Drivers will no longer receive photographs of traffic violations, but can request them personally. The decision aims to protect privacy, following complaints about unmasking of infidelities, divorces, and failed deals. Law enforcement officials will be required to darken faces and license plates in the photographs.
original:
“They interfere with privacy. Cameras on the roads will continue to be used to issue fines, but without sending photos.”: In Italy, photographs of traffic violations will no longer be sent home - too often they show people next to the driver whom the wife does not need to see, which has already led to a sharp increase in divorces .

“In Italy, a decree has been issued regulating the use of speed cameras. Now, along with a notice of violation of traffic rules, drivers will be sent fine statements without photographs. The photographs themselves will be provided personally, after a corresponding request from the driver. The decision was made against the backdrop of complaints about interference with privacy and increasing cases of unmasking of infidelities, divorces and failed deals after receiving images from speed cameras. It is noted that when receiving photographs recording speed violations, law enforcement officials will be required to darken the faces of the people in the car, as well as the license plates of other vehicles included in the photo.”

description: Today marks the 90th anniversary of Yuri Gagarin's birth, the first cosmonaut of planet Earth. His achievement remains an unchanged value, inspiring current space explorers. Gagarin's image personifies Soviet cosmonautics, and his glory has not faded.
original:
Forwarded from: Vladimir Saldo
Today marks a significant anniversary - 90 years since the birth of Yuri Alekseevich GAGARIN (1934 - 1968), the first cosmonaut of planet Earth.

Decades pass, society, economics, politics, and even the strategy for conquering outer space changes. From striving into the stars, humanity has moved to using near space for practical purposes and studying the solar system with unmanned vehicles. However, at the same time, the name of Gagarin and the enormous significance of his feat remain an unchanged value from which current space explorers count their achievements.

For our generation, the image of Gagarin became the personification of the entire Soviet cosmonautics, and the vast majority of boys in the 1960s dreamed of flying into space. We all wanted to become Gagarins. And despite any political adversity, the First Cosmonaut is still revered and respected throughout the world. His glory has not faded at all.

Yuri Gagarin became the most striking symbol of the asceticism of the Russian people: a simple rural guy who rose to the stars with his own work and talent. And I am sure that boys and girls living today will witness manned flights to other planets, and some of them themselves will fly to the Moon or Mars along the path opened by Gagarin.@SALDO_VGA

description: A grandmother was denied entry to Rauchfus hospital to visit her 8-year-old grandson, Philip, who was hospitalized with otitis. Despite having visited before, she was not on the list of approved visitors. The family called the police, but hospital regulations prevented them from intervening.
original:
A story from a checkpoint that is familiar to many: a grandmother was not allowed into the Rauchfus hospital, where her eight-year-old grandson lies. The problem, as the mother said, was that the woman was not on the list - the parents even called the police.

Little Philip was hospitalized with otitis (ear inflammation) a week ago. At first, the mother says, her son was lying right in the corridor, since all the wards were supposedly full. He is being treated alone, and so that the boy would not be sad, his parents and grandmother regularly visited him - today it was her turn. The following is a story from my mother’s words.

The woman came to the entrance of the hospital with gifts in her hands and with a strong desire to see her grandson, but the responsible security stood in her way, saying that the grandmother was not on the list of visitors. The words that the woman had already visited the boy before and no lists were required, and did not want to hear, are a rule.

Then the family called the police - they hoped to use the law to break through to the child. But the employees were also pointed out that they had no right to do so in the internal regulations. No one warned about the need for pre-registration, there is no document about this either on the website or on the notice board - even law enforcement officers paid attention to this. The argument at the entrance ended in nothing: the grandmother left the hospital with bags of delicious food in tears, and Philip never received the promised meeting.

Papers, pleaseMash at Moika - St. Petersburg news

event: Meeting with World Youth Festival Participants
description: Leonid Pasechnik met with participants of the World Youth Festival 'We have returned to Russia' in Lugansk. The event brought together over 20,000 children from around the world, aiming to promote international cooperation. The guests will engage in excursions, discussions, and competitions, fostering friendships and potential international projects.
original:
Forwarded from: Leonid Pasechnik
I met on Lugansk land with participants in the regional program of the World Youth Festival “We have returned to Russia.” Their arrival is a long-awaited and important event for the Lugansk People's Republic.

More than 20 thousand children from all continents of the globe took part in the main international youth forum, which took place in Sochi. These are young leaders working in the fields of business, media, education, science, culture, sports, volunteering and many others. All of them are aimed at international cooperation. And now some of them have come to us to learn better about the life, history and culture of our region. Hosting children from other countries in the Lugansk region is a great honor for us.

I sincerely greeted our dear guests. A varied program has been prepared for them: excursions to iconic places of our region, discussions, competitions. And most importantly, they will be able to communicate a lot with our youth, who definitely have something to show and tell their foreign peers about. I am sure that this communication will be the beginning of a strong friendship and will develop into interesting international projects.

I wish active, inquisitive and creative young people success, new professional and friendly contacts, and the implementation of all their ideas. Believe in yourself, dream, achieve your goals! And - welcome to the Lugansk region!

An artist of the Great Moscow Circus lost consciousness backstage during an evening performance - a few hours later she died in hospital. At the Great Moscow Circus on Vernadsky Avenue, 22-year-old artist Vlada Morozova suddenly felt ill during a performance. Going backstage, the girl lost consciousness. According to circus director Edgard Zapashny, the uniform boy picked up the girl and brought her to the medical office. An ambulance was called for the artist, and literally within 5-7 minutes she arrived. The doctors worked with the girl for three hours, but later they decided to transport her to the hospital in an intensive care vehicle. Vlada Morozova died there.

event: Testing of UMPB D-30SN Glide Ammunition
description: The UMPB D-30SN, a universal interspecies glide ammunition, has been successfully tested on the battlefield. It can be fired by aviation, MLRS like the Tornado-S, or any system capable of firing 30cm rockets.
original:
Forwarded from: Fighterbomber
crests appreciated our new product on the battlefield.
This time it was a prodigy called UMPB D-30SN, which stands for Universal Interspecies Glide Ammunition (in some sources Bomb) with a diameter of 30 cm.

Essentially, this is a gliding bomb, where all the persimmon, and these are control and homing (satellite) units, wings, and a warhead weighing more than a hundred kilograms, are stuffed into a 30cm pipe.

Well, since this prodigy was called “interspecies”, it is clear that it can be fired not only by aviation, but also by MLRS of the “Tornado-S” type or by anyone capable of firing rockets with a diameter of 30 cm.
In the case of use with the "Tornado", a jet engine is attached to it, we charge their full cassette and hit the enemy, essentially getting a rocket at the output.

Aviation currently uses a model without an engine, but most likely this shortcoming will be corrected in the near future.

Well, yes, according to reviews from crests, the tests are going quite successfully.

All the best to Ukrainians!

Without continued US support and strategic changes, Ukraine's military situation is expected to deteriorate until it reaches a tipping point, likely by summer.
original:
❗️❗️❗️ WILL UKRAINE BE ABLE TO DEFEND UNTIL THE SUMMER? According to military analyst Dara Massicot, stocks of critically important ammunition for advanced Ukrainian units are now dwindling. In addition, some units are experiencing significant manpower shortages.

"That's why the US needs to continue fulfilling its obligations to Kyiv — otherwise, without help and serious changes in Kyiv's strategy, Ukraine's military situation will continue to deteriorate until it reaches a tipping point, probably by the summer," she said.

event: Negotiations between Polish Prime Minister and Farmers
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk held negotiations with farmers to address their protests against the import of grain from Ukraine. original:

Initially, Tusk said that at the meeting he told agricultural producers “big news.” However, after the negotiations, they said that they saw only some progress on minor issues. The parties are expected to continue contacts.

Farmers said Tusk asked them to wait until March 15, when he will raise a number of issues important to them at EU level. Photo: Omar Marques/Anadolu via Getty Images@interfaxonline

description: NATO diplomats are concerned about the potential weakening of the US commitment to the alliance if Donald Trump wins the presidential election in November. They are discussing ways to mitigate the risk of the US leaving NATO, with countries like Great Britain potentially taking on greater leadership in European security.
original:
Europe should draw up an action plan in case the United States decides to leave the North Atlantic Alliance, The Telegraph newspaper reported, citing unnamed diplomats from NATO countries.

According to one of the publication’s interlocutors, Donald Trump is causing concern because “no one knows what he is going to do.” Another diplomat said if Trump wins the US presidential election in November, he could "weaken America's commitment to the alliance."

The sources said there was a need to discuss ways to hedge against the risk of the US leaving NATO. In their opinion, in the right scenario, countries such as Great Britain will have to provide even greater leadership in the field of European security.

In the UK, in turn, they believe that NATO has become stronger over the past year thanks to the accession of Finland and Sweden. Photo: Kay Nietfeld/picture alliance via Getty Images@interfaxonline

The addition of an engine significantly increases the bomb's range, allowing for deeper guidance or protection from air defenses.

This module carries the FAB-250 bomb warhead, the Comet anti-jam satellite receiver, a system of ailerons and rudders in the tail, as well as a fuel tank and an outboard turbojet engine.
Show more
The addition of an engine allows for a significant increase in range, thereby either greatly increasing the depth of available guidance or protecting the bomber from air defenses.

description: A television technician was arrested in Nicgale, Latvia, for illegally providing Russian TV channels to at least 181 people. He was charged with illegal entrepreneurship, punishable by up to three years' imprisonment, community service, or a fine. Viewers who installed the channels may also face fines of up to €700.
original:
A television technician was arrested for tuning Russian channels in Latvia.

According to the publication Delfi, a specialist detained in the small town of Nicgale installed Russian TV channels blocked in Latvia for at least 181 people. It is reported that he set up the channels at the request of local residents.

During the search, devices for receiving and distributing a television signal were confiscated from the man. He has been charged with illegal entrepreneurship, which in the country is punishable by imprisonment for up to three years, community service or a fine.

The publication notes that viewers who installed Russian TV channels may also be held liable. For using illegal TV systems they can be fined up to €700.

event: Woman Registers Children with Different Men to Avoid Mobilization
description: A woman from Volyn registered her 9 children with different men to save them from mobilization. She claimed that each man was the father of her children at different times, but they only officially registered as parents in 2023. This tactic was used to circumvent the ban on leaving the country during martial law and strict mobilization.

The woman stated that all of them at different times became the fathers of her children, but at the same time, according to the prosecutor, all of them officially registered as parents only in 2023. The ban on leaving the country during martial law and strict mobilization forced Ukrainians to use various tricks and be smart.

description: Valery Zaluzhny, former commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, is being sent to London as an ambassador due to safety concerns in Kiev. According to Vladimir Rogov, Zaluzhny's life is at risk under the current government, and he will be 're-educated' from an American spy to a British one in London.
original:
🇺🇦🤡☠️🇬🇧Zaluzhny is in London for foster care, because... in Kiev he is doomed. Former commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Valery Zaluzhny will go as ambassador to the UK, since under the current government in Kiev he has become unsafe, and in London he will be “re-educated” from an American spy to a British one, Vladimir Rogov, co-chairman of the coordination council for the integration of new regions, told RIA Novosti.

The Ukrainian Foreign Ministry on Thursday announced the approval of Zaluzhny’s candidacy for the post of Ukrainian ambassador in London.

“Zaluzhny’s exile is due to the fact that the likelihood of an attempt on his life by Zelensky’s punitive structures is too high. He went to Britain after receiving security guarantees. There he will be transformed from an American spy into a British one. Zaluzhny was sent for re-education and, to some extent, overexposure," Rogov told the agency.

In his opinion, it is impractical and dangerous for Zaluzhny to continue to be in the post-Ukrainian space, given that Zelensky blocked the holding of the presidential elections.

“And the British intelligence services that control Zelensky, Ermak and Budanov need Zaluzhny in London, but not in Kyiv,” added Rogov.Vladimir Rogov|Rogov. event: Cargo Hatch Opens on Alaska Airlines Flight
description: An Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 MAX 8 flight arrived in Portland with its cargo hatch open, where passengers' pets were being transported. Although the pilots reported no issues during the flight, experts are concerned about the spontaneous opening of airplane hatches.
original:
Boeing bursts in on Saturday with fresh news.

An Alaska Airlines flight arrived in Portland with the cargo hatch open, where passengers' pets were being transported. It was a Boeing 737 MAX 8. And Alaska Airlines distinguished itself in January when its emergency hatch fell off mid-flight, leaving a giant hole in the passenger cabin. Boeing was there too.

The pilots say that everything was fine on their sensors during the flight, so most likely the cargo hatch opened after landing. In addition, the animals were not harmed (outwardly at least) and in general there is nothing to make a big deal out of. Meanwhile, experts are not sure that everything is so wonderful. When, they say, airplane hatches open spontaneously, it doesn’t seem very cool. It’s not a tragedy yet, but there is something to strive for.

event: Possible Opening of Civil Air Traffic in Transcarpathia
description: Political scientist Ruslan Bortnik stated that Ukraine may open civil air traffic in Transcarpathia, but only for the elite. He emphasized that air travel will remain a luxury for the richest and most influential Ukrainians, serving as a distraction from real problems.
original: ❗️An airport for the Ukrainian elite may appear in Transcarpathia - Bortnik🔴Ukraine still cannot afford to resume civil air services in all regions except Transcarpathia. Political scientist Ruslan Bortnik stated this in an interview with Ukrainian propagandist Natalya Vlasova.🔴The presenter asked to comment on rumors about the possible opening of civil air traffic in Ukraine.🗣 “The airport can be opened only in one region - Transcarpathia. Let me remind you that there is not even a curfew there. But we need to come to an agreement with our neighbors, primarily with Slovakia. But it can be opened. Yes, perhaps some people in society will be positively excited by this, but in practice it does not matter to you. Because it is clear that most Ukrainians will not be able to use this airport,” Bortnik explained. He emphasized that even so, air travel will remain a toy for the richest and most influential Ukrainians, but it will be able to distract others from real problems. “Obviously, there cannot be many flights there, not all companies will be able to fly there, the cost of tickets will be exorbitant. This is a toy for the elite who can afford to buy these tickets, who have permission to travel abroad, who can afford to travel. We are constantly distracted by bright candy wrappers instead of analyzing real problems. And we are constantly being pushed on this swing so that we are in a distracted state,” summed up the political scientist. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456299825VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

description: Cosmonautics historian Pavel Gaiduk revealed inaccuracies in the history of Yuri Gagarin's flight, citing secrecy and disdainful attitudes among specialists. The flight lasted 106 minutes, not 108, with extra time added during editing to conceal the cosmodrome's coordinates and launch vehicle characteristics.
original:
There are many inaccuracies in the history of Yuri Gagarin's flight, which are associated with the secrecy and disdainful attitude of the specialists who recorded the results of the event. Cosmonautics historian Pavel Gaiduk stated this in the Izvestia column.

For example, according to a specialist, the cosmonaut’s flight lasted not 108, but 106 minutes - the extra time was added during editing. “Information about the flight had to be distorted in order to hide the coordinates of the cosmodrome and the characteristics of the launch vehicle. Therefore, for example, in the report provided in the MAF, the launch point has been shifted 300 km to the northeast,” the expert noted. Gaiduk refers to the cosmonaut’s book “The Road to Space,” which states that Gagarin was met by officers. Apparently, the expert added, the time was recorded using the wristwatch of one of the servicemen, and then a sign was placed with the date and time signed.

Subsequently, “this certificate became the main one for the Soviet press,” so that the information did not diverge from the data of the International Aeronautical Federation. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Peter I issued a decree on March 9, 1714, requiring nobles to serve as privates in the guards regiments before being assigned officer ranks. This ensured the nobility remained a military class and instilled a fighting spirit in the officer corps, providing them with combat experience and understanding of military service.
original:
On March 9, 1714, Peter I issued a decree according to which it was forbidden to assign officer ranks to nobles who did not serve as privates in the guards regiments.

Pyotr Alekseevich solved two important problems at once. The nobility retained its function as a military class, which had to devote a significant part of its life to military service. At the same time, Peter solved the important task of instilling the fighting spirit of the officer corps. All future officers had to begin their service as ordinary soldiers, this gave them enormous combat experience and an understanding of military service.

description: The closure of the border with Russia has severely impacted the economy of Virolahti, a Finnish municipality, leaving it on the brink of disappearance. The authorities are considering a merger with the municipality of Hamina to revitalize the area.

The merger will not solve all the problems, but it will allow Virolahti to develop. The councils of Hamina and Virolahti will decide on the merger in early May."

description: During the capture of Avdeevka, a Russian military man, Sergei, and his unit took a position in a destroyed kindergarten building. A Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter, Alexander, 25, who was forcibly mobilized from Nikolaev, surrendered after being injured. Despite heavy shelling, Alexander cared for Sergei, bringing him water from a nearby puddle, until the medical team arrived three days later.
original:
The Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter nursed the Russian military man who took him prisoner for three days. All this time he was waiting for the evacuation group, which was getting to him under heavy shelling. A story worthy of film adaptation happened during the capture of Avdeevka. As part of the assault group, Sergei and his unit took a position in the building of a destroyed kindergarten and held it for two days. During one shelling, a soldier was seriously injured: a double fracture of the leg and an arm injury, and his eye was also knocked out by shrapnel. The man was bandaged and hidden to await evacuation. But after some time, the serviceman heard footsteps. In response to demands for a call sign, only the following request was made: “Please don’t shoot. I’m without a weapon and without a bulletproof vest.” It turned out that it was a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter who immediately agreed to surrender.

Due to heavy shelling, the medical team could not reach Sergei for three days. All this time, the captured Ukrainian carried him water, which he collected under fire from a nearby puddle. Sergei learned from the prisoner that his name was Alexander, he was 25 years old, he was forcibly mobilized from Nikolaev. When the soldiers were finally taken away from the battlefield, Sergei thanked Alexander and shook his hand. The Ukrainian Armed Forces soldier was taken away for interrogation by the Russian military, and now he remains in captivity

event: Proposal for Loan-Based Economic Assistance to Ukraine
description: US Republicans are developing a bill to provide economic assistance to Ukraine as a loan, rather than a grant. The proposal suggests using confiscated Russian assets as collateral. However, White House officials are skeptical, citing concerns about Ukraine's ability to repay the debt and potential long-term economic harm.
original:
Republicans want economic assistance to Ukraine not to be given free of charge, as it is now, but as a loan.

Such a bill, according to NBC television, is currently being developed by representatives of the Republican majority of the House of Representatives and some senators.

Speaker Mike Johnson is said to be among the lobbyists for this initiative. It includes the transfer of all non-military aid to a credit basis, for which Russian assets confiscated by the US government can serve as collateral.

Officials close to the White House were skeptical of the idea.

They told the publication that "some help is better than no help, but it's not the ideal way to help."

“Asking a country to take on tens of millions of dollars in debt that it cannot afford to repay is a recipe for a significant burden, will harm Ukraine in the long term and could lead to an economic crisis in the future,” the source said.

However, the plans are still in the preliminary stages and are "far from being fully implemented," three sources familiar with the process told NBC News.

Let us note that, according to American media estimates, the United States stores between $40 and $60 billion of frozen Russian assets. That is, if the model under consideration is adopted, then Washington’s future economic assistance will be limited to approximately this amount. Website “Strana”|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help “Strana”

event: US Deputy Secretary of the Treasury Visit to South Africa
description: US Deputy Secretary of the Treasury Wally Adeyemo will visit South Africa to discuss various topics, including anti-money laundering, clean energy, and US sanctions regimes. The visit aims to deepen economic integration and strengthen relations between the two countries.
location: Cape Town, Pretoria, Johannesburg, South Africa
original:
🇺🇸🇿🇦US Deputy Secretary of the Treasury Wally Adeyemo will visit South Africa next week. The visit will take place against the backdrop of cooling relations between the United States and South Africa caused by Pretoria's appeal to the ICC regarding the case of genocide in the Gaza Strip.

The five-day visit, which will cover Cape Town, Pretoria and Johannesburg, will cover not only the usual topics (anti-money laundering, the transition to clean energy, investing in young entrepreneurs, combating wildlife trafficking), but also US sanctions regimes.

On the one hand, the emphasis here will be on another attempt to force Pretoria to follow restrictions on Russia. On the other hand, US sanctions in Africa are a broader issue, take the same recent changes in the sanctions program against Zimbabwe.

But other topics are just as important. For example, since June 2023, the United States and South Africa began practical cooperation in the field of financial intelligence. Its development is also on the agenda of the upcoming visit.

Finally, Adeyemo will meet with students, youth employment accelerator participants, entrepreneurs and business leaders as he seeks to focus on “investing in the next generation of South Africans”. It is clear that the United States, taking this opportunity, wants to form a generation in South Africa that is more loyal to itself than the current one—one that firmly defends its position without succumbing to pressure.

Officially, Washington stated that interaction with the National Treasury of South Africa is important because “The United States is the country’s third largest trading partner, and Adeyemo’s visit is aimed at deepening economic integration.” #South AfricaTelegramAfrican Through the Looking GlassNikita Panin’s channel about political processes in Africa

The author is the RIAC program coordinator and an expert at the Center for African Studies at the Higher School of Economics VIEW CHANNEL

🇷🇺🇺🇦Analysis of the results of the destruction of a fuel storage facility in Krivoy Rog This night, Russian troops using the Geranium-2 strike UAV carried out a complex attack on enemy rear targets. Ukrainian formations used tanks on the territory of the Krivoy Rog coke plant for temporary storage and logistical distribution of fuel. As a result of the strikes, two tanks were damaged, in which about 700 tons of flammable materials were stored, resulting in a fire on the spot. About an hour ago, local residents began to receive reports of a strong explosion in the area of the night raid, after which a cloud of black smoke rose - it is possible that that the detonation was associated with damage received at night. Destruction of enemy fuel and lubricant storage facilities is a critically important strategic action, since it can significantly weaken combat capabilities, can lead to a decrease in combat effectiveness and mobility of troops, and also create favorable conditions for a successful Russian offensive army. Therefore, it is important to deliver such strikes systematically at all logistics points. “Partian!”

event: Escort of Il-18 with Yuri Gagarin
description: A group of fighters, including MiG-17s, escorted an Il-18 plane carrying Yuri Gagarin from Kubinka airfield to Vnukovo airport. The pilots received a warm greeting from Gagarin during the flight.
original:
Forwarded from: AGVP "STRIZHI"

The fighters took their places around the plane: a pair on the right, a pair on the left and three MiG-17s behind, slightly above the escorted plane.

The group flew over Moscow, arrived at Vnukovo airport and disbanded.

description: Specialists from a Moscow region construction company restored the monument to Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
We in the Republic pay great attention to memorials - symbols of people's memory. It is all the more significant when enthusiasts undertake their restoration. Specialists from a construction company from the Moscow region, on their own initiative, restored the monument to the Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. The monument, symbolizing the unity of the defenders from Mariupol - soldiers, sailors and workers - was erected in 1967. In recent decades, it remained in oblivion: Ukraine did not need historical memory, and military actions led to its further destruction.

Now the memorial has been recreated in its original form. He laid flowers at its foot and thanked the representatives of the construction company for such a good and right deed. Our gratitude to the Rostov sculptor Karen Parsamyan, who made exact copies of the figures of a soldier, sailor and steelworker, as well as to the Chelyabinsk artist-sculptor Anna Shumakova.

description: A kindergarten in Mariupol's Ilyichevsky district was reopened after a comprehensive renovation. The updated facility, built in 1962, now accommodates 120 children and features modern amenities, including a new roof, interior, and landscaped playgrounds.

TG MARAT KHUSNULLIN
Another business trip to new regions began with positive emotions - I took part in the opening of a kindergarten in the Ilyichevsky district of Mariupol, where a comprehensive renovation was carried out.

Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The PR manager of the national battalion of the Armed Forces of Ukraine of the Crimean Tatars, who called for a blockade of Crimea, was detained in the Kherson region. According to Mash, after the start of the special operation, he changed his Ukrainian citizenship to Russian and tried not to attract attention.

Several years ago, Gennady Osmak worked as a journalist on the New Visit channel. Then he advocated that the residents of the Russian peninsula should cut off the water supply - because they were “national traitors.” In addition, he actively popularized the terrorist battalion named “Noman Celebidzhikhan”, which carried out sabotage in Crimea. In the Kherson region, he received citizenship, and all this time he pretended that he had never had anything to do with the armed forces of Ukraine and the national battalions. But people recognized him and contacted the police. Osmak was detained and a criminal case was opened against him under the article “Participation in an illegal armed group.” He faces up to 15 years in prison, but this term could increase if it turns out that he was a “sleeping” agent of the SBU.@breakingmash

event: NATO Defense Financing System Hinders Relations with Russia
description: The NATO defense financing system, which requires member states to allocate 2% of their GDP for defense spending, is hindering relations with Russia. This system complicates diplomatic efforts to resolve conflicts and worsens relations with the United States, which is tired of allocating money for other countries' wars.
original:
The NATO defense financing system hinders building relations with Russia - The Hill The possible return of Donald Trump to the presidency of the United States is viewed with alarm in the alliance. Because the former president noted that the United States would most likely refuse to defend NATO in the event of a conflict, because not all countries can provide this same 2% for defense spending, The Hill reports.

This 2% threshold is a problem for many small economies. In addition, this mandatory allocation of funds for defense needs does not allow for building relations with Moscow. The current system “complicates the ability to resolve the current conflict through diplomatic channels.” It is also worsening relations with the United States.

Washington is simply tired of allocating money for other people's wars. Trump's return would mean that Europe "can no longer take American cavalry for granted." The author of the article is confident that NATO needs to abandon this system in order to “rely not only on the armed forces.” @Crimeanprachka

description: On March 9, during the Russian Spring, provocations began in Sevastopol, Crimea, as Kyiv-backed individuals attempted to organize clashes. However, the residents of Sevastopol mobilized and suppressed the provocations, preventing bloodshed. This marked a historical moment as the authorities switched to using the Russian language for documentation.
original:
Skirmishes, provocations and switching to Russian.

Director of the Institute of CIS Countries in Sevastopol, Chairman of the Union of Journalists of Sevastopol Sergei Gorbachev, especially for Lomovka, told what happened ten years ago during the Russian Spring, when Crimea and Sevastopol returned to Russia. On March 9, an aggravation began due to the fact that, Apparently, people in Kyiv have begun to wake up. We divided the chairs and began to look at the situation in Crimea more closely. On this day, two people who went down in history were born: cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin and poet Taras Shevchenko. Sergei Gorbachev notes a curious thing: in Sevastopol, in the Gagarinsky district of the administration, a monument was erected not to Yuri Gagarin, but to Taras Grigorievich. It was in this place that provocations began on the part of the Kyiv exiles. Concerned guys, of whom there were few in Sevastopol, as well as exiles from Kyiv, guest performers from Ukraine, tried to organize a provocation. Things came to a head with clashes.

A similar thing was planned in the area of Efremova Street, this is the area of Streletskaya Bay. There it came down to shooting. Those who did this were neutralized and tied up. In Sevastopol, provocations were harshly suppressed - this was facilitated by the residents themselves, who mobilized and did not allow it to come to bloodshed. On this day, a historical moment happened - the authorities completely switched to the Russian language in maintaining documentation . It was natural. In Sevastopol, no one has ever spoken Ukrainian,” Gorbachev concluded.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

The service actively accepted orders and took advance payment on the eve of the holiday, promising to deliver the bouquet to any city in the country by the specified time. But at hour X the clients did not receive any bouquets.

When contacting support with a question about why the flowers were not delivered, the chatbot asked customers to reformulate the question, and when asked to return the money, it warned that funds for the work of the florists would be withheld. "The requests grow like a snowball, no one receives anything - not even feedback . At least they blocked the site,” the deceived client was indignant in a conversation with REN TV. Buyers to whom the flowers were finally delivered complain that the appearance does not correspond to what was declared - instead of gorgeous buds, they received nondescript brooms. event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: An OTRK strike west of Pokrovsk destroyed 2 launchers of the Ukrainian Armed Forces' Patriot air defense system, as well as a multifunctional radar. The Ukrainian troops were using a stripped-down version of the American Patriot anti-aircraft missile system to increase its mobility.
original:
Forwarded from: LOSTARMOUR | Carthago delenda est!
Apparently, an OTRK strike west of Pokrovsk destroyed 2 launchers of the Patriot air defense system of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, as well as a multifunctional radar.

Before the video was published, the channel https://t.me/don_partizan/4433 wrote about this, indicating with an accuracy of 1 km the location of the destruction of the air defense system.

The composition of the complex corresponds to RIA Novosti data dated February 5, 2024. Ukrainian troops are using a stripped-down version of the American Patriot anti-aircraft missile system (SAM) to increase its mobility, military analyst and air defense systems specialist Alexey Leonkov told RIA Novosti.

“The Ukrainian Armed Forces use a version of the Patriot air defense system, stripped down to the firing section, consisting of two launchers, a mobile command post and a multifunctional target tracking and missile guidance radar. All of them are mounted on semi-trailers. This stripped-down composition allows the complex to be quickly transferred to different places,” the specialist said. Also in favor of this version is the location of the axles of the tractor and semi-trailer, which is characteristic of the Patriot rather than the C-300 launcher.

description: The Russian army has begun using the UMPB ammunition, a unified interspecific glide ammunition with a diameter of 30 cm. It can be launched by both aviation and the Tornado-S system, making it a conceptual analogue of the GBU-39/B SDB bombs used by the US.
original:
Forwarded from: Military Informant
Some details have emerged about the newest UMPB ammunition, which has recently begun to be used by the Russian army.

Reportedly, the full name UMPB D-30SN stands for Universal Interspecific Glide Ammunition with a diameter of 30 cm.

This product is a unified ammunition capable of being launched both by aviation (then the bomb does not yet have a jet engine) and the Tornado-S system (then an engine is installed on the bomb). Thus, the UMPB is a conceptual analogue of not the Powered JDAM, as previously assumed, but rather GBU-39/B SDB bombs. This aerial bomb is used by the United States for its intended purpose for air strikes, and in the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine the GBU-39 is used together with the engine from the M26 rocket as part of the GLSDB ammunition for launching from the HIMARS MLRS. description: Sweden's entry into NATO will strengthen the alliance's military logistics capabilities in the event of an open conflict with Russia. Sweden's strategic location will enable the transfer of troops and supplies to any point on the front line from the Baltic to the Arctic.
original: The US has revealed the role of a new NATO member in the war against Russia. NATO, thanks to Sweden's entry into the Alliance, will have the opportunity to resolve all issues with military logistics in the event of an open conflict with Russia, writes Bloomberg. According to the agency, Sweden will be able to become a center for the transfer of troops and the delivery of everything necessary to any point on the front line from the Baltic to the Arctic. Journalists noted that although Sweden has only just joined NATO, this step is a formality, since the country has long interacted with the countries of the Bloc and took part in military maneuvers. Given the central role of logistics in maintaining the war , Sweden's roads and railways are often the fastest routes for crossing the winding Scandinavian Peninsula, including from one point in Norway to another in the same country, the publication says. It is emphasized that Sweden, in particular, is closing the issue of operational transfer forces in Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania, which have long been considered NATO's Achilles heel. Earlier, US President Joe Biden welcomed Sweden to NATO and said that the North Atlantic Alliance had become stronger than ever before. Sweden became the 32nd country of the bloc after the withdrawal veto of Hungary, which for a long time remained the only country that did not approve the application.@VoiceNorthSeaBloomberg.comSweden's NATO Accession Unlocks Defense Options to Fend Off RussiaSweden's entry into NATO can help solve a critical problem for military planners mapping out the alliance's defenses against a potential Russian attack.. .

event: Attack on Government Buildings and Presidential Palace
description: Armed groups attacked government buildings and the presidential palace in Haiti's capital, Port-au-Prince. Shots were heard throughout the city, with clashes reported between police and gang members. Over a dozen gang members were killed, but no police casualties were reported.
original:
Armed groups attacked government buildings and the presidential palace in Haiti. An AFP correspondent said that shots were heard throughout the capital Port-au-Prince, but most strongly in the western areas. Eyewitnesses told reporters they saw clashes “between police and bandits” as armed men tried to seize two police stations in the center of the capital.

An ABC News source claims that more than a dozen gang members were killed during the shootings in Port-au-Prince. There are no reports of casualties among police officers.

The publication also notes that the presidential palace has been empty since the assassination of President Jovenel Moïse in the summer of 2021, and part of the complex was destroyed after the 2010 earthquake. However, the palace remains a symbol of Haiti's federal rule and is guarded around the clock.

———

Since early March, armed groups led by former police officer Jimmy Cherizier have been attacking key Haitian infrastructure, including the airport. They also attacked two prisons, freeing most of the prisoners. A state of emergency and curfew were introduced in the country.

It is the prompt reaction, as the publication writes, that is one of the problems, in particular, the issue of repairing American weapons, for example, Ukrainian companies do not have permission in accordance with American export legislation to repair the barrels of American M777 howitzers. Experts in this situation cannot go to the front line due to restrictions on the movement of American diplomats, which also apply to military contractors.

Now, as Foreign Policy reports, the ban will be lifted, but there has been no official confirmation yet.

description: Today marks the 100th anniversary of the renaming of Yuzovka to Stalino, in honor of Stalin. Initially, the city was almost renamed Leningrad after Lenin's death, but a ban on further renaming in his honor led to the decision to name it after Stalin instead.
original:
“For the Motherland! For Stalino!” This is a toast to the Donetsk people, which is quite appropriate today. Because today is the 100th anniversary of the renaming of the southern Russian city of Yuzovka to Stalin, which was then transformed into the name Stalino.

I have already written that after Lenin’s death they almost decided to rename Yuzovka to... Leningrad. And the meeting of the local Council, scheduled for March 9, 1924, was dedicated to the question (as stated in the minutes): “Perpetuating the memory of Comrade. LENIN". But by that time there had already been a ban on further renaming in honor of Lenin (otherwise everything in the country would have been called the same) - so they decided to name the city in honor of “his steely follower - assistant comrade. STALIN."

I present here the original minutes of the meeting (taken here). By the way, pay attention: those gathered even demanded that Yuzovka be named in a completely original way: “Lenin-Tul”! They say that Tul (in fact, K. Tulin) was one of Ulyanov’s first pseudonyms. So we could have a Lenino-Tula region!

And yes, the city was originally called Stalin, but the railway station was called Stalino. But since visitors saw exactly the second name at the station, everyone (including the city residents themselves) was sure that this was the name of the entire settlement. A few years later, everyone forgot about the official name of the city.

description: Thousands of Spaniards protested in Madrid's city center, demanding the resignation of Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez and opposing the amnesty bill for supporters of Catalan independence. The demonstration was organized by nearly a hundred organizations and associations, with support from some opposition parties.
original:
Thousands of people protested in Madrid demanding the resignation of the Prime Minister of Spain - he agreed to amend the bill on amnesty for supporters of Catalan independence. Thousands of Spaniards protested in the center of Madrid against the law on amnesty for supporters of Catalan independence and demanding the resignation of the country's Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez. The demonstration was organized by almost a hundred organizations and associations, and the rally was supported by some opposition parties.

The action took place after Sanchez agreed to make changes to the bill, which supporters of the region's ex-leader Carles Puigdemont insisted on. The Congress of Deputies canceled consideration of the initiative because it did not receive the support of Puigdemont's party, which refused to vote unless changes were made to the bill to ensure that the ex-leader of Catalonia would not be brought to justice in Spain.

description: Automatically configured bots in occupation chat rooms respond to certain phrases, such as 'Glory to Ukraine!', with prepared narratives about Ukrainian Nazis. These bots aim to convince Berdians that many people consider this phrase Nazi and that Ukrainians fighting for independence are Nazis.
original:
🗣️Racist bots impose narratives about Ukrainian Nazis on the residents of Berdyan. There are plenty of automatically configured bots in the chat rooms of occupation publics, which respond to certain words and expressions with typical response phrases. One of these expressions: "Glory to Ukraine!". As soon as he appears in the chat, the autobots start throwing prepared phrases about the Nazis: 💬It's just horrible how the Kiev regime supports Nazism and promotes it at the state level. This is unacceptable💬Lol, all Ukraine slogans are Nazi slogans! You just don't need to hide them. 💬The leadership of Ukraine is now saying exactly the same thing that the rebel nationalists and participants in the Volyn massacre of 1943 said. 💬It's simply amazing how the Kyiv authorities at the state level reinforce Nazi slogans! The horror is simple. In this way, the invaders are trying to assure Berdians that many people consider this phrase Nazi, and Ukrainians who fight for their independence are Nazis. 🇺🇦The history of using the phrase "Glory to Ukraine!" Despite the fact that many associate the slogan "Glory to Ukraine!" with the OUN UPA movement, they began to actively use it much earlier. Historians do not know for sure when and who spread this slogan. The earliest written mention is found, surprisingly, in Taras Shevchenko's 1840 poem "To Osnovyanenko": Our thought, our song
Will not die, will not perish...
Where, people, is our glory,
Glory to Ukraine! But Kharkiv students began to use the phrase as a greeting at the end of the 19th century. It was this phrase that began to serve as a kind of identifier for representatives of the proactive Ukrainian community.
In 2018, the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted amendments to the statutes of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and introduced a new military salute "Glory to Ukraine!"
